definition-item.definition-title: DECORATING TEXTILES (textile threads, filaments, yarns or tow, glued on macromolecular material D06N7/00)

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
The decoration of textile materials by chemical action or by the fixation of particulate on the textile surface.
This subclass does not cover treatment of textiles by purely mechanical means, which is covered by subclasses D06B - D06J.
This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Textile threads, filaments, yarns or tow, glued on macromolecular material

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Metallising the entire surface of textiles

section-body.paragraph-text: An overlapping might occur with processes for decorating in general any surface which are covered by B44C, B44D and B44F.
An overlapping might also occur with the dyeing of textile materials D06P and the chemical treatment of textile materials D06M.
An overlapping might also occur with D06C23/00 which is covering more mechanical aspects for making patterns or designs on fabrics.
Treatment of selected parts of textile materials is classified in group D06B11/00.
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Reserving parts of the material before dyeing or printing textiles

section-body.paragraph-text: In case of overlapping, it is recommended to classify in as much as possible groups, i.e. in all the relevant groups.
In case several treatment are combined or made applied successively, it is recommended to allocate a class for each treatment.
In case a decorating treatment is carried out in combination with a dyeing or printing process, it is recommended to also allocate the relevant classes in D06P in addition to the D06Q classes.

definition-item.definition-title: Producing patterns by locally destroying or modifying the fibres of a web by chemical actions, e.g. making translucent

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:

The swelling or the partial dissolution or melting of fibres to make patterns, the treatment of fibres by chemical means to make them translucent, the production of so called "lace" by chemical means.
All the treatment are chemical treatments.
An overlapping might occur with D04C1/04, covering carbonised or like lace.
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:
In case of overlapping with D04C1/04, it is recommended to also classify in D06Q1/02.

definition-item.definition-title: by metallising (transfer of metal particles D06Q1/12)

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
The metallisation of textile materials, only for decorative purposes.
An overlapping might occur with D06M11/83 which is covering the metallisation of textile materials in general, but not for decorative purposes.
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

With regard to metallisation of textile surfaces it is recommended to also classify in D06M11/83, as the same process could also be used to produce metallised textile materials but with another functionality than decorative purposes.

definition-item.definition-title: by local treatment of pile fabrics with chemical means

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
The decoration of pile fabrics like carpets or sponge towels by locally treating them with chemical compositions.
There might be an overlapping with D06N dealing with the coating of textile substrates with macromolecular materials, e.g. the backing of pile fabrics to make carpets.
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:
In case the pile fabric is locally modified by chemical treatment, it is recommended to also classify in D06Q1/02.

definition-item.definition-title: by fixation of mechanical effects, e.g. calendering, embossing or Chintz effects, using chemical means

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
The decoration of textile materials by fixation of mechanical effects by chemical means.

There might be an overlapping with D06M11/84, D06M13/52, D06M13/525, D06M15/70 and D06M15/705. All these groups are dealing with the combination of chemical and mechanical treatments like embossing, calendering or pressing.

definition-item.definition-title: by treatment with, or fixation of, a particulate material, e.g. mica, glass beads (by metallising D06Q1/04; by transferring D06Q1/12)

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:

The fixation of decorative particulate materials like glass beads, glass particles, gem stones , glitters, plastic particles, feathers, mica, fibres etc for decorative purposes generally with the aid of an adhesive composition but not necessary.
The flocking of textile materials when flock fibres are directly deposited onto the surface of the textile materials.
This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: The local deposition of pigment with a binder, i.e. pigment printing
The treatment of textile materials with stone materials or sand to discolour them i.e. to create a stone washed effect

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Process for flocking in general by pulverisation
Process for flocking in general by other mean than pulverisation
Non-woven pile fabrics which may be obtained by flocking.

section-body.paragraph-text: The fixation of metal particles should be classified in D06Q1/04.

definition-item.definition-title: by transferring a chemical agent or a metallic or non-metallic material in particulate or other form, from a solid temporary carrier to the textile {(for uniform treatment D06M23/02)}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
The transfer of the decorative material or the transfer of the adhesive composition to the textile.
This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: The transfer printing of textile materials

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

definition-item.definition-title: by transferring fibres, or adhesives for fibres, to the textile

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:

The transfer of fibres or adhesives for fibres to the textile, e.g. the flocking of textile when the flock or the adhesive are first deposited on an intermediate support before their application to the textile surface.
